logic.pieces package¶

Submodules¶

logic.pieces.bishop module¶

class logic.pieces.bishop.Bishop(color)¶

Bases: logic.pieces.piece.Piece

generate_possible_moves(board, old_x, old_y)¶

Generates all possible moves that a bishop can make. It does not check to see if the move will leave a player checked. So not every move generated by this function is actually a valid move.

Parameters

  • board (Board) – The chess board

  • old_x (Int) – The x location the piece is starting at

  • old_y (Int) – The y location the piece is starting at

Returns

List of all possible moves

Return type

List

logic.pieces.piece module¶

class logic.pieces.piece.Piece(color)¶

Bases: object

Abstract class that all chess pieces will extend. Keeps track of a pieces color, unicode value, and can test to see if a move is valid.

generate_possible_moves(board, old_x, old_y)¶

Generates all possible moves that a piece can make. It does not check to see if the move will leave a player checked. So not every move generated by this function is actually a valid move. :param board: The chess board :type board: Board :param old_x: The x location the piece is starting at :type old_x: Int :param old_y: The y location the piece is starting at :type old_y: Int :returns: List of all possible moves :rtype: List

move_is_valid(board, old_x, old_y, new_x, new_y)¶

Checks to see if a certain move is valid.

Parameters

  • board (Board) – The chess board

  • old_x (Int) – The starting x coord of the piece

  • old_y (Int) – The starting y coord of the piece

  • new_x (Int) – The target x coord of the piece

  • new_y (Int) – The target y coord of the piece

Returns

Whether or not a certain move is a valid move

Return type

Boolean
